DataElement.preferredName: Neuroglial Tumor Oligodendroglioma Cellular Differentiation Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for result of tumor cells showing oligodendroglial differentiation expressed in percent.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells).  Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas.  Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors.  Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas. -- 2004_In cancer, refers to how mature (developed) the cancer cells are in a tumor. Differentiated tumor cells resemble normal cells and tend to grow and spread at a slower rate than undifferentiated or poorly differentiated tumor cells, which lack the structure and function of normal cells and grow uncontrollably.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells).  Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas.  Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors.  Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells). Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas. Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors. Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: In cancer, refers to how mature (developed) the cancer cells are in a tumor. Differentiated tumor cells resemble normal cells and tend to grow and spread at a slower rate than undifferentiated or poorly differentiated tumor cells, which lack the structure and function of normal cells and grow uncontrollably.

Concepts.definition: In cancer, refers to how mature (developed) the cancer cells are in a tumor. Differentiated tumor cells resemble normal cells and tend to grow and spread at a slower rate than undifferentiated or poorly differentiated tumor cells, which lack the structure and function of normal cells and grow uncontrollably.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of L.Dillon 4/2011

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A well-differentiated (WHO grade II), diffusely infiltrating neuroglial tumor of adults, typically located in the cerebral hemispheres.  It is composed predominantly of cells which morphologically resemble oligodendroglia. The neoplastic cells have rounded homogeneous nuclei and, on paraffin sections, a swollen, clear cytoplasm ('honeycomb' appearance).  It generally recurs locally, with median post-operative survival times ranging from 3 to 5 years for patients with all histological grades. (Adapted from WHO.)_In cancer, refers to how mature (developed) the cancer cells are in a tumor. Differentiated tumor cells resemble normal cells and tend to grow and spread at a slower rate than undifferentiated or poorly differentiated tumor cells, which lack the structure and function of normal cells and grow uncontrollably._Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

It is composed predominantly of cells which morphologically resemble oligodendroglia. The neoplastic cells have rounded homogeneous nuclei and, on paraffin sections, a swollen, clear cytoplasm ('honeycomb' appearance).  It generally recurs locally, with median post-operative survival times ranging from 3 to 5 years for patients with all histological grades. Concepts.definition: A well-differentiated (WHO grade 2), diffusely infiltrating neuroglial tumor, typically located in the cerebral hemispheres.  It is composed predominantly of cells which morphologically resemble oligodendroglia. The neoplastic cells have rounded homogeneous nuclei and, on paraffin sections, a swollen, clear cytoplasm ('honeycomb' appearance). (Adapted from WHO)

In cancer, refers to how mature (developed) the cancer cells are in a tumor. Differentiated tumor cells resemble normal cells and tend to grow and spread at a slower rate than undifferentiated or poorly differentiated tumor cells, which lack the structure and function of normal cells and grow uncontrollably.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
